info.title: Redmine API
info.description:
Redmine exposes some of its data through a REST API. This API provides 
access and basic CRUD operations (create, update, delete) for the resources 
described below. The API supports both XML and JSON formats.

get.summary: Listing issues
get.description:
Returns a paginated list of issues. By default, it returns open issues only.  
NB: operators containing ">", "<" or "=" should be hex-encoded so they're parsed correctly. Most evolved API clients will do that for you by default, but for the sake of clarity the following examples have been written with no such magic feature in mind.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: column to sort with. Append :desc to invert the order.

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: fetch associated data (optional, use comma to fetch multiple associations). Possible values:

parameters.name: issue_id
parameters.description: get issue with the given id or multiple issues by id using ',' to separate id

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: get issues from the project with the given id (a numeric value, not a project identifier).

parameters.name: subproject_id
parameters.description: get issues from the subproject with the given id. You can use project_id=XXX&subproject_id=!* to get only the issues of a given project and none of its subprojects.

parameters.name: tracker_id
parameters.description: get issues from the tracker with the given id

parameters.name: query_id
parameters.description: you can get the corresponding issue list using

parameters.name: status_id
parameters.description: get issues with the given status id only. Possible values: open, closed, * to get open and closed issues, status id

parameters.name: assigned_to_id
parameters.description: get issues which are assigned to the given user id. me can be used instead an ID to fetch all issues from the logged in user (via API key or HTTP auth)

parameters.name: parent_id
parameters.description: get issues whose parent issue is given id

parameters.name: cf_x
parameters.description: get issues with the given value for custom field with an ID of x. (Custom field must have 'used as a filter' checked.)

parameters.name: subject
parameters.description: may use ~ before string value

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: may use ~ before string value

parameters.name: notes
parameters.description: may use ~ before string value

parameters.name: closed_on
parameters.description: may use ~ before string value

parameters.name: attachment
parameters.description: may has ~ at the beginning. Search into field 'filename' attachments

parameters.name: attachment_description
parameters.description: may has ~ at the beginning. Search into field 'description' attachments

parameters.name: updated_by
parameters.description: id an user which has made changes in journal

parameters.name: last_updated_by
parameters.description: id a last user which has made changes in journal

parameters.name: relation_type
parameters.description: array of string through comma

parameters.name: created_on
parameters.description: To fetch issues for a date range

parameters.name: updated_on
parameters.description: To fetch issues updated after a certain timestamp

get.summary: Showing an issue

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: fetch associated data (optional, use comma to fetch multiple associations). Possible values:

get.summary: returns the relations for the issue of given id (:issue_id).

post.summary: Creates a relation for the issue of given id (:issue_id).

422.description: relation was not created due to validation failures (response body contains the error messages)

get.summary:
Returns the list of groups.
This endpoint requires admin privileges.

post.summary:
Creates a group.
This endpoint requires admin privileges.

get.summary:
Returns details of a group.
This endpoint requires admin privileges.

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: a coma separated list of associations to include in the response:

put.summary:
Updates an existing group.
This endpoint requires admin privileges.

delete.summary:
Deletes an existing group.
This endpoint requires admin privileges.

post.summary: Adds an existing user to a group. This endpoint requires admin privileges.

204.description: user was added to the group

delete.summary: Removes a user from a group. This endpoint requires admin privileges.

204.description: user was removed to the group

get.summary: Returns possible Status Values for Issues
List trackers
get.description: Returns the list of all trackers.

get.summary: Returns a list of users. This endpoint requires admin privileges.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: get only users with the given status. See app/models/principal.rb for a list of available statuses. Supply an empty value to match all users regardless of their status. Default is 1 (active users)

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: filter users on their login, firstname, lastname and mail ; if the pattern contains a space, it will also return users whose firstname match the first word or lastname match the second word

parameters.name: group_id
parameters.description: get only users who are members of the given group. Don't replace components/parameters/group_id

post.summary: Creates a user.This endpoint requires admin privileges.

422.description: user was not created due to validation failures (response body contains the error messages)

get.summary:
Returns the user details. You can use /users/current.:format for retrieving the user whose credentials are used to access the API.
This endpoint can be used by admin or non admin but the returned fields will depend on the privileges of the requesting user

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: a comma separated list of associations to include in the response:

items.description:
memberships - adds extra information about user's memberships and roles on the projects
groups - adds extra information about user's groups

put.summary:
Updates a user.
This endpoint requires admin privileges.

delete.summary:
This endpoint requires admin privileges.
Deletes a user.

get.summary: Returns the version of given id.

put.summary: Updates the version of given id

422.description: version was not updated due to validation failures (response body contains the error messages)

delete.summary: Deletes the version of given id.

422.description: version was not deleted (response body contains the error messages)

get.summary: Returns list of checklist items for issue issue_id

Returns all the custom fields definitions.
This endpoint requires admin privileges.
Returns enum for given Type
Listing projects
get.description: Returns all projects (all public projects and private projects where user have access to)

parameters.name: include
parameters.description:
fetch associated data (optional). Possible values: trackers, issue_categories, enabled_modules (since 2.6.0).
Values should be separated by a comma ",".

422.description: project was not created due to validation failures (response body contains the error messages)

get.summary: Showing a project
get.description: Returns the project of given id or identifier.

parameters.name: include
parameters.description:
fetch associated data (optional). Possible values: trackers, issue_categories, enabled_modules (since 2.6.0).
Values should be separated by a comma ",".

put.description: Updates the project of given id or identifier.

delete.description: Deletes the project of given id or identifier.

get.summary: Returns the versions available for the project of given id or identifier (:project_id). The response may include shared versions from other projects.

post.summary: Creates a version for the project of given id or identifier (:project_id).

422.description: version was not created due to validation failures (response body contains the error messages)

get.summary: Returns the issue category of given id.

put.summary: Updates the issue category of given id

422.description: issue category was not created due to validation failures (response body contains the error messages)

delete.summary: Deletes the issue category of given id.

parameters.name: reassign_to_id
parameters.description: when there are issues assigned to the category you are deleting, this parameter lets you reassign these issues to the category with this id

get.summary: Returns the issue categories available for the project of given id or identifier (:project_id).

post.summary: Creates an issue category for the project of given id or identifier (:project_id).

get.summary: Returns a paginated list of the project memberships. :project_id can be either the project numerical id or the project identifier.

422.description: membership was not created due to validation failures (response body contains the error messages)

get.summary: Shows Account data
Shows Time entries

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: The user identifier number

parameters.name: subproject_id
parameters.description: The user identifier number

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: The user identifier number

parameters.name: spent_on
parameters.description: The user identifier number

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Date syntax: YYYY-MM-DD

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: Date syntax: YYYY-MM-DD

parameters.name: issue_id
parameters.description: The user identifier number

parameters.name: author_id
parameters.description: The user identifier number

parameters.name: activity_id
parameters.description: The user identifier number

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: sort=spent_on:desc

get.summary: Show time entry
get.description: Returns the time entry of given id.

422.description: time entry was not updated due to validation failures (response body contains the error messages)

get.summary: Returns the membership of given :id.

put.summary: Updates the membership of given :id. Only the roles can be updated, the project and the user of a membership are read-only.

422.description: membership was not updated due to validation failures (response body contains the error messages)

delete.summary:
Deletes a memberships.
Memberships inherited from a group membership can not be deleted. You must delete the group membership.

get.summary: Returns the relation of given id.

delete.summary: Deletes the relation of given id.

422.description: relation was not deleted (response body contains the error messages)

get.summary: Returns the search results by the specified condition parameters

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: query strings. enable to specify multiple values separated by a space ' '

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: search scope condition

schema.description: 'search all projects', 'search assigned projects', 'include subproject when project specified'

parameters.name: all_words
parameters.description: matched all query strings or not

parameters.name: titles_only
parameters.description: matched only title or not

parameters.name: issues
parameters.description: include Issues or not

parameters.name: news
parameters.description: include News or not

parameters.name: documents
parameters.description: include Documents or not

parameters.name: changesets
parameters.description: include Changesets or not

parameters.name: wiki_pages
parameters.description: include Wiki Pages or not

parameters.name: messages
parameters.description: include Messages or not

parameters.name: projects
parameters.description: include Projects or not

parameters.name: open_issues
parameters.description: filtered by open issues

parameters.name: attachments
parameters.description: filtered by description and attachment

get.summary: Returns the list of all custom queries visible by the user (public and private queries) for all projects.
Returns the list of roles.
Returns the list of permissions for a given role

status.description: a numeric id representing the status of the user, visible for admins only (added in 2.4.0). STATUS_ANONYMOUS = 0; STATUS_ACTIVE=1; STATUS_REGISTERED=2; STATUS_LOCKED=3

is_done.description: 'yes|no... field position low row was removed'

Returns details of a group.
This endpoint requires admin privileges

 Name not used, need fo pascal code

is_private.description: 'Use true or false to indicate whether the issue is private or not'

fixed_version_id.description: . ID of the Target Versions (previously called "Fixed Version" and still referred to as such in the API)

watcher_user_ids.description: Array of user ids to add as watchers

fixed_version_id.description: . ID of the Target Versions (previously called "Fixed Version" and still referred to as such in the API)

assigned_to_id.title: AssignedToId
assigned_to_id.description: ID of the user to assign the issue to (currently no mechanism to assign by name)

watcher_user_ids.title: WatcherUserIds
watcher_user_ids.description: Array of user ids to add as watchers

assigned_to.description: the id of the user assigned to the category (new issues with this category are assigned by default to this user)
the id of the user assigned to the category (new issues with this category are assigned by default to this user)

role_ids.description: an array of roles numerical ids

user_id.description: the numerical id of the user or group

role_ids.description: an array of roles numerical ids

id.description: the numerical id of the user or group

status.description: 1: status active, 5: status closed, 9: status archived
1: status active, 5: status closed, 9: status archived

default_assigned_to_id.description: ID of the default user. It works only when the new project is a subproject and it inherits the members.

default_version_id.description: ID of the default version. It works only with existing shared versions.

tracker_ids.description: (repeatable element) the tracker id: 1 for Bug, etc.

enabled_module_names.description: (repeatable element) the module name: boards, calendar, documents, files, gantt, issue_tracking, news, repository, time_tracking, wiki.

issue_to_id.description: the id of the related issue
the id of the related issue

user_id.description: id of the user to add as a watcher

api_key.description: the API key of the user, visible for admins and for yourself

status.description: a numeric id representing the status of the user, visible for admins only (added in 2.4.0). STATUS_ANONYMOUS = 0; STATUS_ACTIVE=1; STATUS_REGISTERED=2; STATUS_LOCKED=3

send_information.description: Send account information to the user

issue_id.title: IssueId
issue_id.description: the issue id to log time on (only one id is required).the issue id or project id to log time on (both are integers)

project_id.title: ProjectId
project_id.description: the project id to log time on (only one id is required).the issue id or project id to log time on (both are integers)

spent_on.title: SpentOn
spent_on.description: the date the time was spent (default to the current date); format is e.g. 2020-12-24

activity_id.title: ActivityId
activity_id.description: the id of the time activity. This parameter is required unless a default activity is defined in Redmine.

comments.title: Comments
comments.description: short description for the entry (255 characters max)

user_id.title: UserId
user_id.description: user id to be specified in need of posting time on behalf of another user
id of the user to add as a watcher

offset_param.name: offset
offset_param.description: the offset of the first object to retrieve

entry_id.name: entry_id
entry_id.description: id of the entry to update
